definition: to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Do not go for wealth ; even that fades away.
sentences.chinese: 不要追求万贯家财，财产也会散尽。

sentences.english: His son diced himself out of a large fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他儿子掷骰子赌输了万贯家财。

definition: glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
ten thousand strings of cash/very wealthy/millionaire
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
lit. just sitting and eating, one can deplete even a mountain of wealth (idiom)/fig. to spend one's money without generating any income
